abstract: Dozens of corporate boards, including those of Halliburton, Kraft, Home Depot and Waste Management, insist or recommend their C.E.O.’s fly on private jets for security reasons. It’s a common corporate tax trick.
snippet: Dozens of corporate boards, including those of Halliburton, Kraft, Home Depot and Waste Management, insist or recommend their C.E.O.’s fly on private jets for security reasons. It’s a common corporate tax trick.
lead_paragraph: Most people would think that Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg of the Supreme Court would need more security than Alan R. Mulally, the chief executive of Ford Motor Company.

headline.main: For Some Corporate Chiefs, Private Security Is a Tax Break
